revised_title: An Account of the Lisbon Earthquake of 1764
tldr: The author describes the experience of the Lisbon earthquake of December 26, 1764, and shares a method for measuring the strength and direction of future shocks using a spherical vessel filled with water. The earthquake was a sudden, perpendicular heaving up, unlike previous undulatory ones, causing little damage but leaving a lasting impression on the author and the community.
